titleStmt.title: Botanologia the Brittish physician, or, the nature and vertues of English plants, exactly describing such plants as grow naturally in our land, with their several names Greek, Latine, or English, natures, places where they grow ... : by means whereof people may gather their own physick under every hedge ... : with two exact tables, the one of the English and Latine names of the plants, the other of the diseases and names of each plant appropriated to the diseases, with their cures / by Robert Turner.
titleStmt.author: Turner, Robert, fl. 1640-1664.

titleStmt.title: Botanologia the Brittish physician, or, the nature and vertues of English plants, exactly describing such plants as grow naturally in our land, with their several names Greek, Latine, or English, natures, places where they grow ... : by means whereof people may gather their own physick under every hedge ... : with two exact tables, the one of the English and Latine names of the plants, the other of the diseases and names of each plant appropriated to the diseases, with their cures / by Robert Turner.
titleStmt.author: Turner, Robert, fl. 1640-1664.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R. Wood for Nath. Brook at the Angel in Cornhill,

notesStmt.note: Item at reel 2521:15 incorrectly identified as Wing 3328A.
Imperfect: item at reel 2521:15 lacking leaf A1, pp. 177-192, 305-363, leaves 2A7-8; pages faded and copy is tightly bound.
Reproductions of originals in the Bodleian Library and Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine, London, England.
